description.narrative: The project will focus on addressing the new challenges to civil peace and peace building posed by the Syrian crisis. The focus is on education, media, local level peace building and an MGO platform promoting nation-wide truth and reconciliation.

participating-org.narrative: US Department of State, Office to monitor & combat Tracking in persons.

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1) Number of educators teaching Lebanese and Syrian students trained 2) Number of newsletters produced 3) Number of Peace building News Supplements published 4) Number of initiatives implemented to support collective memory through non-formal education channels. 5) Number of schools adopting the violence free schools principles 6) Number of history teachers trained on teaching sensitive topics 7) Number of reports produced on the implementation of the Journalists’ Pact 8) Number of media outlets cooperating to produce supplements 9) Number of regions targeted by local level interventions 10) Local level peace building strategies and mechanisms implemented in at least three conflict-prone areas 11) Number of local leaders trained on mediation, conflict resolution and crisis management 12) Awareness raised among the population about truth, reconciliation and dealing with the past 13) Ex-fighters supported to play a positive role and convey messages of peace 14) Consultations held with different segments of the Lebanese society 15) Number of conflict assessments and maps produced

comment.narrative: 1) Rising tensions in schools hosting Syrian refugees 2) Absence of a collective memory of the civil war 3) High level of violence in Lebanese public and private schools 4) Absence of context-specific peace education content in the current high school curricula (including civics/history/geography education 5) Limited opportunities within the formal education sector to build a collective memory 6) Absence of new and modern ways of teaching history and sensitive topics 7) Need to implement master training for teacher trainers in use of Peace Building Toolbox 8) Limited initiatives involving young generation in oral history and the need to work on historical narrative 9)Lack of impartial and multifaceted reporting on issues affecting social cohesion in Lebanon and with communities hosting Syrian refugees in particular 10)The Journalists’ Pact for Strengthening Civil Peace signed but not yet implemented 11)Limited media monitoring on the type of and effects of reporting 12)Poor or biased coverage of strategic issues regarding the implementation of past agreements 13)Lack of channels for conveying positive messages through media 14) Absence of sustained peace building and dialogue mechanisms to mitigate the risks of potential violence at the local level 15) Limited awareness of the role that local actors such as municipalities and mukhtars can play in conflict prevention and mitigation. 16) Worsening tension between the Lebanese host communities and the Syrian refugees 17) Lack of a joint road map and a national strategy for truth and reconciliation 18) Limited field research on the perception of the causes, lived experience, and impact of the civil war in Lebanon, 19) Lack of consultation and coordination with state, non-state and other various segments of the Lebanese society on reconciliation 20) Absence awareness among the population about truth, reconciliation and dealing with the past through media 21) Absence of active
